You know, I found a way to gently lighten my hair myself, after my first hairdresser put some kind of acid in my hair and almost ruined my balayage. Until I found my second hairdresser (Hani, you know I love you) here is what I did: I used purple concentrate shampoo from L'Oréal (Chroma) to get rid of the acid and then I used a purple conditioner from the same brand, as well as their hair mask. Once I thought the hair was soft enough, I let it air-dry, which really helped with hair loss. Keep in mind, I had to do this every day for about two months straight, but the effort was worth it.

Nowadays my hair is completely healthy again and after a nice new haircut, I generally use lavender-infused oil on days where I know I won't wash my hair, leave it in during the night and then scrub my scalp with a black hair peeling – it has mint, charcoal and bamboo in it and takes care of all the buildup from other products. Then, I use another brand of purple shampoo and conditioner, as well as a hair mask, but depending on how long I left the oil in for, I need to use a blue-green shampoo to truly get rid of everything and to help with hair growth. They're all from the same brand (Kérastase).

On busy days, I wash my hair with the purple shampoo and just use a leave-in conditioner, as well as a hair serum (Kérastase, again). If you must blow-dry your hair, I recommend spraying your hair with a little bit of your favourite perfume first, comb your hands through it and let it dry on your hair follicles before you use your blow dryer. Do it the night before you need to be somewhere, so that the next day, you wake up with a slightly lighter hair colour and your favourite scent surrounding you in public without it being obtrusive.

컬러토닝 샴푸는 컬러 트리트먼트랑 비슷한 느낌인 거 같네요.
전 쨍하고 탁한 색이 싫고 파스텔 톤의 색상들을 좋아해서 일부러 탈색 빡시게 한 다음(노란기 없게) 컬러 트리트먼트로 색을 입히고 색 빠지는 거 보면서 덧 입히거나 다른 색을 섞어서 천천히 색을 체인지 하거나 했거든요. 
어차피 색 빠질 때쯤이면 이미 그 색이 질려서 다른 색 하고 싶어할 정도로 쉽게 질리는 편이라 가벼운 색 좋아하시면서 자주 색 바꾸고 싶어하시는 분들은 이 방법도 추천드려요
